documentation.content:
## Domain and URL Module Updates

```python
patch: `domain` & `url` modules by @yozachar in [#339](https://github.com/python-validators/validators/pull/339)
```

## Packaging and Documentation Fixes

```python
fix: packaging as well as `rST` & `md` document generation by @yozachar in [#337](ttps://github.com/python-validators/validators/pull/337)
```

## Documentation Generation and Preview

```sh
$ . ./.venv/bin/activate
# generate documentation
$ python package/export TYPE # where TYPE is any of `doc`, `man` or `web`.

# To preview mkdocs
$ mkdocs serve
# To preview man pages
$ man docs/_build/man/validators.1
# To preview sphinx webpages
$ python -m http.server -d docs/_build/web
```

## SEDOL Validation

```python
from validators import finance

# Example usage:
print(finance.sedol('2000001')) # True
print(finance.sedol('invalid-sedol')) # False
```

## Domain Validation Consistency

```python
fix: `domain` validation is now more consistent across rfcs by @yozachar in [#347](https://github.com/python-validators/validators/pull/347)
```

## Development Setup and Testing

```sh
# clone repository
$ git clone "https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/validators.git"
# change directory 
$ cd validators
# install development dependencies
$ pdm install

# activate virtual environment
$ . ./.venv/bin/activate # replace `/bin/` with `/Scripts/` if you're on Windows.
# run tox for linting, type checking, formatting etc.
$ tox
```

## Financial Identifier Validation

```python
import validators

# Validate CUSIP
print(validators.finance.cusip('123456789'))

# Validate ISIN
print(validators.finance.isin('US0378331005'))

# Validate SEDOL
print(validators.finance.sedol('1234567'))
```

## Basic Usage Example

```python
import validators
print(validators.email('someone@example.com'))
```

## Fix between and length Validators

```python
maint: fix `between` & `length` validators by @yozachar in [#334](https://github.com/python-validators/validators/pull/334)
```

## Tagging and Pushing for Release

```sh
# syncing with upstream
$ git pull upstream master
$ git push
# tagging that final merge commit before release
$ GIT_COMMITTER_DATE=$(git log -n1 --pretty=%aD) git tag -a -m "vMAJOR.MINOR.PATCH" MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH
# pushing tag to remote
$ git push --tag
$ git push upstream --tag
```
